channel.title: Class, interface, or enum expected

item.title: Class, interface, or enum expected
item.dc:creator: @Deathrod Deathrod
item.description:
@Deathrod wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:3, topic:350470”]Or much more likely its the second package declaration

[quote]package com.rs2hd.packethandler;
import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession;
package com.rs2hd.packethandler;

import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession;[/quote]

Delete the big bold red line and you’re good to go.[/quote]
omfg thanks you!!!

Or much more likely its the second package declaration

package com.rs2hd.packethandler; import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession; [b]package com.rs2hd.packethandler;[/b]

import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession;

Delete the big bold red line and you’re good to go.

item.title: Class, interface, or enum expected
item.dc:creator: @Deathrod Deathrod
item.description:
@Deathrod wrote:

hey guys i just compiled the server and got 1 error

Compiling rs2hd/*java rs2hd/*.java complete src/com/rs2hd/packethandler/communication/.java:3 class, interface, or enum expe cted package com.rs2hd.packethandler; ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
anyone help? also this happened after adding mute thing the code for communication is
package com.rs2hd.packethandler; import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession; package com.rs2hd.packethandler;

import org.apache.mina.common.IoSession;

import com.rs2hd.model.ChatMessage;
import com.rs2hd.model.Player;
import com.rs2hd.net.Packet;
import com.rs2hd.util.Misc;

/**
*

  • Packets relating to communicating with other players.

  • @author Luke132
    */
    public class Communication implements PacketHandler {

    private static final int PUBLIC = 24;

    @Override
    public void handlePacket(Player player, IoSession session, Packet packet) {
    switch(packet.getId()) {
    case PUBLIC:
    handlePublicChat(player, packet);
    break;
    }
    }

    private void handlePublicChat(Player player, Packet packet) {
    try {
    int colour = packet.readByte();
    int effects = packet.readByte();
    int numChars = packet.readByte();
    String text = Misc.decryptPlayerChat(packet, numChars);
    if(player.muted == 0) {
    player.setLastChatMessage(new ChatMessage(colour, numChars, text));
    player.getUpdateFlags().setChatTextUpdateRequired(true);
    }
    else if(player.muted == 1) {
    player.sm(“You are muted and cannot talk”);
    }
    } catch (Exception e) {
    }
    }
    }

Read full topic
